title: Low Elo Players Blaming Jungler
body:
Hello-
     Slowly but surely I'm climbing out of Bronze, and I am currently in B2. I played a game yesterday jingling Lee Sin, and every lane began losing HARD. Naturally, frustration started to rise amongst our team, but blaming Lee Sin ended up bringing everyone together. At the end of the game and all throughout starting at about 2:30 (2:30, while I was in the middle of doing blue [2nd camp], is the first time Katarina got angry at me for not ganking), my teammates started typing things like "report Lee no gank" and "NOOB Jungler shouldnt play ranked report" into the all chat. Now I don't care if people flame me when I'm doing poorly, in fact I actually appreciate it because it makes me play better and I like to hold myself accountable. However, I found this to be ironic because at the end of the game I was the only one on my team with a positive kda (I ended 5-5-6 or something, not very good but objectively better than my team who was 1-9, 3-8,, 4-8, etc).

My question is this: Is there any way of effectively jingling when every lane is feeding relentlessly? Additionally, what makes low elo players so prone to blame the jungler when they lose lane? In my opinion (I'm adc main), you should be able to win your lane even if the jungler never comes at all and you get camped (buy wards, don't overextend, etc). Personally, the only time I get angry with my jungler is if he comes in while I am buying at the fountain and feeds a kill while I ping him back, but even then I don't flame because I realize he's trying his best. This experience makes me not want to jungle in low elo anymore, as I know I now have 4 reports against me even though I had an objectively-ok-ish game (interestingly enough I got 3 honorable opponents from the enemy team while they also stuck up for me in the all chat).

replies.body:
As a jungle main I'll put in my input.  Firstly, you're playing Lee Sin who is made for the early game.  If you're not exerting early game pressure with him you're much better off playing a different champ.  That aside, when your team starts getting behind there are two things you can do.  Firstly, you can look to see whether there are any lanes that are close.  If so, try to get a gank in on them to tip the scales in their favor (even just a blown flash can make all the difference).  If all the lanes are significantly behind, look at the enemy jungler.  Is he playing someone who can duel well early?  If not and you're playing Lee Sin go in for some early aggression in the opposing jungle.  If none of these are a possibility, farm as much and as quickly as possible.  The number one thing you need to be doing as a jungler is always be doing something as it is a role which is very unforgiving if you are wasting a lot of time.

One other thing, even if your team can not fight the other team as a whole, good vision can easily net you picks and objectives.  Just always be looking for those little things which can move you and your team back into the game.

chill, those are the words of those who have never gone jungling
chances are, you may have ddone nothing wrong
there isnt a solution for everything...
what solutions that do exist require sacrifices to be made, and you can be dam sure that no one on your team wants to be that sacrifice
they're mad, they're stupid, they will never understand and once they start blaming you, the hive mind kicks in and behfore you know it.. its jungler vs the world

low elo laners are such a narrow minded bunch you know?
its all ME ME ME and their lane...
they will never see the grand scope of things 
and you can't please them either, you can gank and get blamed or dont gank and get blamed

I've noticed 2 elos where this happens alot:

1. low silver/high bronze.
2. high gold/low plat (from the plat side mostly).

The golds I play with all can play safe. The plats... they will always play super aggro because "enemy just trash gold" so they either get fed or feed horribly.

Lee sin has the luxury of getting sight stone after your smitem. You should be warding for your lanes as you roam around the map. I know it's not your job but its bronze. You literally have to do everything for your team if you want to win.

if every lane is feeding, the best thing you can do is camp one lane and try and get at least them snowballing. Choose the lane that has the strongest carry champ. Ex {{champion:114}} top - do everything you can do get her going and leave the other lanes to fend for themselves. They will flame you and cry about it just ignore them and do your thing. 

The worst thing you can do is spread  yourself too thin by trying to help every lane

To be fair, a jungler either wins or loses a game like, 80% of the time. A horrible jungler feeds every lane, or allows key lanes to get shut down. 
That being said, it sounds like you did fine, and they're just all buttmad.

It's not really surprising that you had a "better" KDA when your source of farm doesn't put you in direct contact with an enemy. People don't just get irrationally angry with you. You were playing an early ganking jungler, you probably walked right past an easy kill, and she got mad at you. I understand that people tend to play scapegoat, but you clearly weren't doing your best to help them.
Remember that this started when he was doing the 2nd camp of the game.
